simplerMultiTouch.library

Class OSCMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • simplerMultiTouch.library.OSCPacket
      • simplerMultiTouch.library.OSCMessage

  • public class OSCMessage
extends OSCPacket
    An simple (non-bundle) OSC message. An OSC message is made up of an address (the receiver of the message) and arguments (the content of the message).
    Author:
    Chandrasekhar Ramakrishnan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OSCMessage()
      Creates an empty OSC Message.
      OSCMessage(java.lang.String address)
      Creates an OSCMessage with an address already initialized.
      OSCMessage(java.lang.String address, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> arguments)
      Creates an OSCMessage with an address and arguments already initialized.
      OSCMessage(java.lang.String address, java.lang.Object[] arguments)
      Deprecated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OSCMessage

        public OSCMessage()
        Creates an empty OSC Message. In order to send this OSC message, you need to set the address and optionally some arguments.

      • OSCMessage

        public OSCMessage(java.lang.String address)
        Creates an OSCMessage with an address already initialized.
        Parameters:
        address - the recipient of this OSC message

      • OSCMessage

        public OSCMessage(java.lang.String address,
                  java.lang.Object[] arguments)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an OSCMessage with an address and arguments already initialized.
        Parameters:
        address - the recipient of this OSC message
        arguments - the data sent to the receiver

        arguments - the data sent to the receiver
